title: Closures: Summary
question: Which of these are true about closures?
hint: Closures can accept parameters and return values, just like regular functions.
correct: Swift provides shorthand parameter names like $0 and $1
If you use external values in  your closure they will be captured.
You can pass closures into functions as parameters.
If the last parameter to a function is a closure, you can use trailing closure syntax.
wrong: If any parameter to a function is a closure, you can use trailing closure syntax.
Swift provides shorthand parameter names like #0 and #1
Closures must always return boolean true or false.
You can't create arrays of closures.
Closures must only use variables declared inside them.
